Converge your business, analytics, data, and technical skills to make a difference and build your career. The British Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI) is currently seeking a co-op student/intern to support projects and initiatives being implemented as part of our Data and Analytics strategy for the Summer and Fall 2025 work terms (May to December).

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

BCI manages a globally diversified portfolio of assets valued at $250.4 billion and is one of Canada's largest institutional investors. We invest globally to support pension and other funds for more than 30 clients based in British Columbia. We are proud to have been chosen as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and BC's Top Employers. These national and provincial competitions recognize employers who offer exceptional workplaces for their employees.

The co-op/intern will work within our Corporate Data & Operations department as part of the Data and Analytics team. This is a great opportunity for you to learn and apply your knowledge to support the implementation of strategy, projects, and services to the corporation. As part of your work, you will help to support change management activities related to these initiatives.

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH

The Corporate Data & Operations team delivers centralized, corporate business services that require partnership and integration across BCI departments. This role will work in the Data and Analytics team, which delivers analytics solutions (e.g. reports and dashboards), curated re-usable datasets, data science, data platforms, and data governance.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

Support the development, documentation and maintenance of data dictionaries, data catalogs, and other data governance artifacts

Assist in the design and implementation of data quality and data validation rules, ensuring that data is of high quality

Participate in data governance meetings and workshops, contributing to discussions and providing insights on data-related issues and challenges

Help conduct data governance training and awareness programs for employees

Gathering requirements for low to medium complexity projects

Work closely with data stewards across the business to understand their scope of data

WHAT WE OFFER

Excellent career development and training by contributing to a strategic program with high visibility

Work with a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment

The development of real-world skills at one of the largest institutional investors in Canada

Exposure to some of the most talented, approachable, and inspiring people in the industry

The ability to opt-in for access to Dialogue, a user-friendly app that offers virtual primary care, employee and family services, and mental health supports

Time to connect with co-op students & interns at BCI - build your network and shared learning

2 paid days per year for volunteering

Competitive pay: Mid / Back Office: $2,260.00 gross bi-weekly or $2,090.00 gross bi-weekly + vacation leave paid based on 6% of salary ($2,260.00 gross biweekly for those with (or working towards) a graduate degree or joining the Investment Strategy & Risk department and $2,090.00 gross biweekly for those with (or working towards) an undergraduate degree, diploma, or certificate)

Travel: if coming to Victoria for this work term, BCI will provide a fixed-rate travel allowance based on your location

THE DETAILS

Work term: Summer and Fall 2025 (May to December)

Department: Corporate Data & Operations

Office Location: 750 Pandora Avenue, Victoria, BC

Spend your off hours exploring beautiful Victoria and Vancouver Island

All co-ops/internships will need to be completed in person at our Victoria office with the option to work one day per week from home. Please note, some positions are not eligible for hybrid work.

THE IDEAL STUDENT

Has a keen interest in the business aspects of data and analytics and making sense of data

Is an effective communicator and good listener

Focuses on value driven innovation

Ready to learn more about the investment management industry and how data drives it

REQUIRED SKILLS

Exhibit a high level of professionalism and excellent interpersonal skills

Ability to meet deadlines while maintaining accuracy, excellent product quality, and attention to detail

Has an interest in data, a dedication to hard work, commitment to the highest ethical standards, and an eagerness to learn

Ability to use Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Outlook

Familiarity using Microsoft 365 tools such as One Drive, SharePoint Online, and MS Teams would be an asset

Ability to read and write basic code scripts in SQL

Familiarity with data governance tools would be beneficial (not required)

A foundation in relevant technical skills, such as SQL, data modeling, and data visualization tools, will help you succeed in this role
